storyTitle: As Data Engineer, I want to map HR employee data fields to the integration schema to achieve accurate data synchronization

testCases.title: Verify correct mapping of mandatory employee fields
preconditions: Data Engineer has valid credentials and access to the system
HR database contains sample employee records with all mandatory fields populated
Integration schema mapping configuration is properly defined
Timekeeping system API is accessible and operational
Network connectivity between HR and timekeeping systems is established

steps.action: Navigate to the data synchronization module and select the HR employee data source
steps.expectedResult: HR employee data source is successfully selected and available for processing

steps.action: Provide sample HR employee data containing all mandatory fields (employee ID, first name, last name, email, department, hire date, employment status)
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the sample data and displays it in the preview pane

steps.action: Initiate the mapping process by clicking 'Apply Mapping' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the data and maps all mandatory fields to the integration schema without errors. Mapping status shows 'Success' with 0 errors

steps.action: Review the mapped data in the integration schema format
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields are correctly mapped with proper data types and formats. No data loss or truncation is observed

steps.action: Trigger the synchronization process by clicking 'Sync to Timekeeping System' button
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process initiates successfully and progress indicator shows data transfer in progress

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization status until completion
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completes successfully with status 'Completed'. Success message displays number of records processed

steps.action: Access the timekeeping system and navigate to the employee records section
steps.expectedResult: Timekeeping system displays the synchronized employee records

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing source HR data with target timekeeping system data for each mandatory field
steps.expectedResult: All employee records match source data accurately. Employee ID, names, email, department, hire date, and employment status are identical in both systems

postconditions: Employee data is successfully synchronized to timekeeping system
No data loss or corruption occurred during mapping and synchronization
Synchronization logs show successful completion
Both systems contain identical employee information

testCases.title: Test handling of invalid data during mapping
preconditions: Data Engineer has valid credentials and access to the system
HR database contains test employee records with intentional data quality issues
Integration schema mapping configuration is properly defined with validation rules
Error logging system is enabled and operational
Test data includes records with invalid data types and missing mandatory fields

steps.action: Navigate to the data synchronization module and select the HR employee data source
steps.expectedResult: HR employee data source is successfully selected

steps.action: Provide HR employee data containing invalid data types (e.g., text in date field, special characters in numeric field)
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the data for validation processing

steps.action: Provide HR employee data with missing mandatory fields (e.g., missing employee ID, missing email address)
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the data for validation processing

steps.action: Initiate the mapping process by clicking 'Apply Mapping' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the data and detects mapping errors. Error summary displays total number of invalid records and error types

steps.action: Navigate to the error logs section and review the detailed error information
steps.expectedResult: Error logs contain detailed field-level information including record identifier, field name, error type, invalid value, and expected format for each error

steps.action: Attempt to trigger synchronization with the dataset containing invalid records by clicking 'Sync to Timekeeping System' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation warning indicating invalid records will be rejected

steps.action: Confirm synchronization to proceed with valid records only
steps.expectedResult: System rejects invalid records and continues processing valid ones. Synchronization status shows number of successful and rejected records

steps.action: Review the synchronization summary report
steps.expectedResult: Report clearly indicates which records were successfully synchronized and which were rejected with reasons

steps.action: Access the detailed error logs and verify accuracy of field-level error information
steps.expectedResult: Logs contain precise information for each rejected record including employee identifier, specific field names with errors, error descriptions, and timestamps

postconditions: Invalid records are rejected and not synchronized to timekeeping system
Valid records are successfully synchronized
Comprehensive error logs are generated with field-level details
Data integrity is maintained in target system
Error report is available for Data Engineer review and remediation

testCases.title: Validate mapping configuration update process
preconditions: Data Engineer has authorized user credentials with mapping configuration permissions
Existing mapping configuration is in place and operational
Audit trail system is enabled and functioning
Test employee data is available for validation
Backup of current mapping configuration exists

steps.action: Log in to the system with authorized Data Engineer credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and user dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the mapping configuration section by clicking 'Configuration' > 'Field Mapping'
steps.expectedResult: Mapping configuration interface loads successfully displaying current mapping rules

steps.action: Verify access permissions by checking available actions (view, edit, save)
steps.expectedResult: All configuration management options are visible and enabled for authorized user

steps.action: Review current mapping rules for HR employee fields to integration schema
steps.expectedResult: Current mapping rules are displayed in a clear, editable format showing source fields, target fields, and transformation rules

steps.action: Modify a mapping rule by changing the transformation format for 'hire_date' field from 'MM/DD/YYYY' to 'YYYY-MM-DD'
steps.expectedResult: Modification is accepted and field shows updated transformation rule

steps.action: Add a comment describing the reason for the mapping change
steps.expectedResult: Comment field accepts the input and displays it with the modified rule

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button to persist the mapping configuration updates
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Mapping configuration saved successfully' and returns to configuration view

steps.action: Navigate to the audit trail section and search for recent mapping configuration changes
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail displays the recent change with timestamp, user ID, field modified, old value, new value, and comment

steps.action: Return to the data synchronization module and load test employee data
steps.expectedResult: Test data is loaded successfully

steps.action: Trigger synchronization with the updated mapping configuration
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process initiates and applies the new mapping rules

steps.action: Verify that the 'hire_date' field is transformed according to the new rule (YYYY-MM-DD format)
steps.expectedResult: Data is mapped according to the new rules without errors. Hire date appears in YYYY-MM-DD format in the integration schema

steps.action: Review synchronization logs to confirm successful application of updated mappings
steps.expectedResult: Logs show successful synchronization with no mapping errors. All records processed with new transformation rules

postconditions: Mapping configuration is successfully updated with new rules
Audit trail contains complete record of the configuration change
Synchronization uses updated mapping rules for all subsequent operations
Data is transformed correctly according to new mapping specifications
System maintains data integrity with updated configuration

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to configure synchronization job schedules to achieve timely data updates

testCases.title: Verify scheduling configuration and job execution
preconditions: Scheduler has valid credentials with scheduling permissions
Synchronization service is running and operational
HR and timekeeping systems are accessible
System clock is synchronized and accurate
No conflicting synchronization jobs are currently scheduled

steps.action: Log in to the system with Scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and Scheduler dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization settings by clicking 'Settings' > 'Synchronization Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization schedule configuration page loads successfully

steps.action: Click 'Create New Schedule' button to configure a new synchronization job
steps.expectedResult: Schedule configuration form is displayed with fields for interval, start time, and job parameters

steps.action: Select 'Hourly' from the interval dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Hourly interval is selected and additional time configuration options appear

steps.action: Set the schedule to run every 1 hour starting from the next hour
steps.expectedResult: Schedule parameters are accepted and displayed in the configuration form

steps.action: Enter a descriptive name for the schedule (e.g., 'Hourly Employee Data Sync')
steps.expectedResult: Schedule name is accepted and displayed

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to persist the configuration
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Schedule saved successfully' with next execution time. Schedule appears in the active schedules list

steps.action: Note the next scheduled execution time and wait for the scheduled job execution time to arrive
steps.expectedResult: System time advances to the scheduled execution time

steps.action: Monitor the job execution dashboard during the scheduled time window
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts automatically at the scheduled time. Job status changes from 'Scheduled' to 'Running'

steps.action: Wait for the job to complete execution
steps.expectedResult: Job completes successfully and status changes to 'Completed'

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization logs section by clicking 'Logs' > 'Synchronization History'
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization logs page loads displaying recent job executions

steps.action: Locate the most recent job execution entry and verify the details
steps.expectedResult: Job is logged as successful with accurate timestamp matching the scheduled time, job name, duration, and number of records processed

postconditions: Synchronization schedule is active and saved in the system
First scheduled job executed successfully at the configured time
Job execution is logged with complete details and timestamp
Schedule remains active for subsequent hourly executions
Data synchronization completed successfully

testCases.title: Test manual synchronization trigger
preconditions: Scheduler has valid credentials with manual synchronization permissions
Synchronization service is running and operational
HR and timekeeping systems are accessible and contain data to synchronize
No synchronization job is currently running
User is logged into the system

steps.action: Log in to the system with authorized Scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and Scheduler dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization control panel by clicking 'Synchronization' > 'Manual Sync'
steps.expectedResult: Manual synchronization interface loads successfully

steps.action: Verify that the manual synchronization trigger button is visible and enabled
steps.expectedResult: Manual trigger button labeled 'Run Sync Now' is visible, enabled, and accessible to the authorized Scheduler

steps.action: Review the current synchronization status display
steps.expectedResult: Status shows 'Ready' or 'Idle' indicating no job is currently running

steps.action: Click the 'Run Sync Now' manual synchronization trigger button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation dialog asking 'Are you sure you want to start synchronization now?'

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' to proceed with manual synchronization
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts immediately. Status changes to 'Running' and progress indicator appears

steps.action: Monitor the job progress on the synchronization dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Progress indicator shows real-time status with percentage complete and records processed

steps.action: Wait for the synchronization job to complete
steps.expectedResult: Job completes successfully. Status changes to 'Completed' and success message displays with summary statistics

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization logs by clicking 'View Logs' button
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization logs page opens displaying recent job executions

steps.action: Verify the manually triggered job appears in the logs with correct details
steps.expectedResult: Job is logged with 'Manual' trigger type, current timestamp, Scheduler username, 'Completed' status, and number of records synchronized

steps.action: Review the detailed job execution log for any errors or warnings
steps.expectedResult: Log shows successful completion with no errors. All records processed successfully

postconditions: Manual synchronization job completed successfully
Job execution is logged with manual trigger indicator
Data is synchronized between HR and timekeeping systems
System is ready for next synchronization job
Logs are updated with complete job details

testCases.title: Validate job retry on failure
preconditions: Scheduler has valid credentials and system access
Synchronization service is running
Retry configuration is set to maximum 3 attempts with 5-minute intervals
Alert notification system is enabled
Test environment allows simulation of job failures
Monitoring dashboard is accessible

steps.action: Log in to the system with Scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the test configuration panel by clicking 'Settings' > 'Test Controls'
steps.expectedResult: Test configuration interface loads successfully

steps.action: Enable failure simulation mode by toggling 'Simulate Job Failure' switch to ON
steps.expectedResult: Failure simulation is enabled. Warning message displays indicating next synchronization job will fail

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization control panel and trigger a manual synchronization job
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts and immediately encounters simulated failure

steps.action: Monitor the job status on the synchronization dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Job status changes to 'Failed'. Error message displays cause of failure

steps.action: Navigate to the logs section and verify failure is logged
steps.expectedResult: Failure is logged with timestamp, error details, and 'Retry Pending' status. Alert notification is generated

steps.action: Check the alert notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed indicating synchronization job failed and automatic retry is scheduled

steps.action: Wait for the configured retry interval (5 minutes) and monitor the system
steps.expectedResult: System automatically retries the job after 5 minutes. Job status shows 'Retrying - Attempt 1 of 3'

steps.action: Observe the first retry attempt with failure simulation still enabled
steps.expectedResult: First retry attempt fails. Status updates to 'Failed - Retry 1'. Next retry is scheduled

steps.action: Wait for the second retry interval and observe the second retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: System automatically retries the job again. Job status shows 'Retrying - Attempt 2 of 3'. Second retry fails

steps.action: Disable failure simulation mode by toggling 'Simulate Job Failure' switch to OFF before the third retry
steps.expectedResult: Failure simulation is disabled. System is ready for normal operation

steps.action: Wait for the third retry interval and observe the final retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: System automatically retries the job for the third time. Job status shows 'Retrying - Attempt 3 of 3'

steps.action: Monitor the third retry attempt execution
steps.expectedResult: Third retry succeeds without simulated failure. Job completes successfully and status changes to 'Completed'

steps.action: Navigate to the detailed job history and review the complete retry sequence
steps.expectedResult: Job history shows initial failure, two failed retry attempts, and final successful retry with timestamps and status for each attempt

steps.action: Verify the final job status in the synchronization logs
steps.expectedResult: Job is marked as 'Successful' after retries. Log includes complete retry history with all attempt details and final success status

postconditions: Job retry mechanism functioned correctly according to configuration
All retry attempts are logged with accurate details
Job ultimately succeeded after retries
Alert notifications were generated appropriately
System returned to normal operational state
Complete audit trail of failure and retry sequence is available

storyTitle: As Data Engineer, I want to handle data transformation errors gracefully to achieve reliable synchronization

testCases.title: Verify detection and logging of transformation errors
preconditions: User is authenticated as Data Engineer with appropriate permissions
Synchronization system is operational and accessible
Test dataset with known transformation errors is prepared
Error logging service is enabled and configured
Database connection is established

steps.action: Prepare test data containing records with known transformation errors (invalid data types, missing required fields, format violations)
steps.expectedResult: Test dataset is ready with at least 5 records containing different types of transformation errors

steps.action: Load the test dataset into the source system for synchronization
steps.expectedResult: Test data is successfully loaded and available for synchronization process

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization dashboard and initiate synchronization process for the test dataset
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process starts and displays 'In Progress' status

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process as it encounters transformation errors
steps.expectedResult: System detects transformation errors and continues processing without stopping. Error counter increments for each invalid record

steps.action: Wait for synchronization process to complete
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completes with status 'Completed with Errors'. Valid records are processed successfully

steps.action: Navigate to error logs section via /sync/errors endpoint or UI
steps.expectedResult: Error logs page loads successfully showing list of logged errors

steps.action: Review error log entries for the completed synchronization job
steps.expectedResult: All transformation errors are logged with detailed context including: timestamp, record identifier, error type, error message, field name, invalid value, and transformation rule violated

steps.action: Verify error classification in the logs
steps.expectedResult: Errors are properly classified by type (data type mismatch, missing field, format violation, business rule violation)

steps.action: Access error reports and verify accessibility
steps.expectedResult: Error reports are accessible, accurately display all logged errors, and provide complete context for troubleshooting

postconditions: All transformation errors are logged in the system
Valid records are successfully synchronized to target system
Invalid records are skipped and marked in error logs
Error logs are available for administrator review
System remains in operational state

testCases.title: Test notification delivery upon error detection
preconditions: User is authenticated as Data Engineer
Administrator accounts are configured with valid email addresses
Notification service is enabled and configured
SMTP or notification gateway is operational
Test data with transformation errors is prepared
Synchronization system is operational

steps.action: Configure notification settings to ensure administrators are subscribed to error notifications
steps.expectedResult: Administrator notification preferences are set to receive error alerts

steps.action: Prepare and load test dataset containing multiple records with transformation errors
steps.expectedResult: Test dataset with error-prone data is loaded into source system

steps.action: Initiate synchronization process with the error-prone dataset
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization starts and begins processing records

steps.action: Monitor system as transformation errors are detected during synchronization
steps.expectedResult: System detects transformation errors and triggers notification mechanism

steps.action: Check notification delivery time from error detection to notification sent
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to administrators within 2 minutes of error detection (promptly)

steps.action: Verify notification recipients list
steps.expectedResult: All configured administrators receive the notification. No unauthorized recipients are included

steps.action: Open and review notification content
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains: error summary with count, job identifier, timestamp, error types breakdown, severity level, and link to detailed error logs

steps.action: Click on the link to detailed error logs provided in the notification
steps.expectedResult: Link navigates directly to the relevant error report with filtered view of the specific synchronization job errors

steps.action: Verify notification format and readability
steps.expectedResult: Notification is well-formatted, easy to read, and contains actionable information for administrators

postconditions: Administrators have received error notifications
Notification logs show successful delivery
Error details are accessible via notification links
System continues normal operation

testCases.title: Validate synchronization performance with errors
preconditions: User is authenticated as Data Engineer with performance monitoring access
Synchronization system is operational
Performance monitoring tools are configured and active
SLA performance baseline is documented (expected synchronization duration)
Large test dataset with known percentage of error-prone records is prepared
System resources are at normal operational levels

steps.action: Review and document the SLA performance limits for synchronization (e.g., maximum duration, throughput requirements)
steps.expectedResult: SLA limits are clearly documented and understood (e.g., synchronization should complete within X minutes for Y records)

steps.action: Prepare test dataset containing 10,000 records with 20% containing transformation errors
steps.expectedResult: Test dataset is ready with 8,000 valid records and 2,000 records with various transformation errors

steps.action: Record baseline synchronization time by running synchronization with 10,000 valid records (no errors)
steps.expectedResult: Baseline synchronization completes successfully and duration is recorded (e.g., 5 minutes)

steps.action: Clear any cached data and reset system to initial state
steps.expectedResult: System is reset and ready for performance test with error-prone data

steps.action: Start performance monitoring tools to track CPU, memory, and I/O metrics
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and recording metrics

steps.action: Initiate synchronization process with the error-prone dataset and start timer
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization starts processing records with timestamp recorded

steps.action: Monitor synchronization progress and observe error handling overhead
steps.expectedResult: System processes records, detects errors, logs them, and continues without stopping. Progress indicator shows steady advancement

steps.action: Wait for synchronization to complete and record end time
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completes with status 'Completed with Errors' and total duration is recorded

steps.action: Calculate total synchronization duration and compare against SLA limits
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization duration with 20% error rate remains within SLA limits (e.g., completes within 6 minutes, not exceeding 20% overhead from baseline)

steps.action: Review performance metrics (CPU, memory, I/O) during synchronization
steps.expectedResult: System resources remain within acceptable operational ranges. No resource exhaustion or bottlenecks observed

steps.action: Verify that valid records were processed at expected throughput rate
steps.expectedResult: 8,000 valid records were successfully synchronized. Throughput meets or exceeds minimum SLA requirements

steps.action: Review error logging overhead impact on performance
steps.expectedResult: Error detection and logging adds minimal overhead (less than 10% performance impact). Error logs are complete and accurate

postconditions: Synchronization performance with errors is documented and within SLA
Valid records are successfully synchronized
All errors are properly logged without performance degradation
Performance metrics are recorded for future reference
System returns to normal operational state

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view synchronization job history to achieve audit and troubleshooting capabilities

testCases.title: Verify recording and retrieval of synchronization job history
preconditions: User is authenticated as Scheduler with appropriate permissions
Synchronization system is operational
Job execution database is accessible and configured
At least 3 different synchronization job types are configured
Job history UI is accessible
Export functionality is enabled

steps.action: Execute a synchronization job of type 'Daily Customer Sync' and wait for completion
steps.expectedResult: Job completes successfully with status 'Completed'. Job execution details are visible in the system

steps.action: Execute a synchronization job of type 'Product Catalog Sync' that completes with errors
steps.expectedResult: Job completes with status 'Completed with Errors'. Error count is displayed

steps.action: Execute a synchronization job of type 'Inventory Sync' and manually stop it mid-execution
steps.expectedResult: Job is stopped with status 'Cancelled'. Partial completion data is recorded

steps.action: Wait 30 seconds to ensure all job metadata is persisted to the database
steps.expectedResult: All three job executions are recorded in the job execution database

steps.action: Navigate to the synchronization job history page via UI or /sync/jobs/history endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Job history page loads within 2 seconds displaying list of recent synchronization jobs

steps.action: Verify that all three executed jobs appear in the job history list
steps.expectedResult: All three jobs are displayed with complete metadata including: job ID, job type, start time, end time, duration, status, records processed, and user who initiated the job

steps.action: Apply date range filter to show only jobs from today
steps.expectedResult: Job history list updates to display only jobs executed today. All three test jobs are visible

steps.action: Apply status filter to show only jobs with status 'Completed with Errors'
steps.expectedResult: Job history list updates to display only the 'Product Catalog Sync' job. Other jobs are filtered out

steps.action: Clear filters and apply job type filter to show only 'Daily Customer Sync' jobs
steps.expectedResult: Job history list updates to display only jobs of type 'Daily Customer Sync'. Filtered results are accurate

steps.action: Clear all filters and sort job history by start time in descending order
steps.expectedResult: Job history list is sorted with most recent jobs appearing first. Sort order is correct

steps.action: Click on one of the job records to view detailed job execution information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view opens showing comprehensive job information including: full metadata, execution timeline, records processed/failed, transformation details, and linked error logs if applicable

steps.action: Return to job history list and select export option for CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with CSV format selected and option to choose date range and filters

steps.action: Configure export to include all jobs from today and initiate export
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated and downloaded successfully. File name includes timestamp

steps.action: Open the exported CSV file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: CSV file contains accurate job information for all three test jobs with columns: job ID, job type, start time, end time, duration, status, records processed, records failed, initiated by

steps.action: Return to job history UI and select export option for JSON format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with JSON format selected

steps.action: Configure export to include all jobs and initiate JSON export
steps.expectedResult: JSON file is generated and downloaded successfully

steps.action: Open the exported JSON file and validate its structure and content
steps.expectedResult: JSON file is well-formed with valid syntax. Contains array of job objects with complete metadata matching the CSV export data

postconditions: All synchronization jobs are recorded with complete metadata
Job history is accessible and displays accurate information
Filters and sorting work correctly
Exported files contain correct and complete job information
System remains in operational state

testCases.title: Test access control for job history feature
preconditions: Multiple user accounts are configured with different roles
Test user account with 'Scheduler' role exists and is active
Test user account with 'Viewer' role (unauthorized) exists and is active
Test user account with no assigned role exists
Role-based access control (RBAC) is enabled and configured
Job history feature has access restrictions configured
At least 5 synchronization jobs exist in job history

steps.action: Log out any currently authenticated user to start with clean session
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully. Session is cleared

steps.action: Attempt to access job history page URL (/sync/jobs/history) without authentication
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. System redirects to login page or returns 401 Unauthorized error

steps.action: Log in using test account with 'Viewer' role (unauthorized for job history)
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful. User is authenticated with 'Viewer' role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to job history page via UI menu or direct URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view job history. Contact your administrator.' Job history menu option is not visible or disabled

steps.action: Attempt to access job history API endpoint directly via /sync/jobs/history GET request
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that no job history data is exposed in the error response
steps.expectedResult: Error response contains only access denial message. No sensitive job data is leaked

steps.action: Log out the 'Viewer' user
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully

steps.action: Log in using test account with no assigned role
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful. User is authenticated but has no specific role assigned

steps.action: Attempt to access job history page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message. User cannot view job history

steps.action: Log out the user with no role
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully

steps.action: Log in using test account with 'Scheduler' role (authorized)
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful. User is authenticated with 'Scheduler' role

steps.action: Navigate to job history page via UI menu
steps.expectedResult: Job history menu option is visible and accessible. User can click to navigate

steps.action: Access job history page
steps.expectedResult: Full access is granted. Job history page loads successfully within 2 seconds displaying all synchronization jobs

steps.action: Verify all job history features are accessible: filtering, sorting, pagination, detailed view, and export
steps.expectedResult: All features are fully functional. Scheduler can view job details, apply filters, sort results, navigate pages, and export data

steps.action: Apply various filters and access detailed job information
steps.expectedResult: All job history data is accessible. Filters work correctly. Detailed job information displays complete metadata

steps.action: Export job history in CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export is successful. CSV file downloads with complete job history data

steps.action: Verify access control is logged in system audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs show denied access attempts by unauthorized users and successful access by Scheduler role

postconditions: Unauthorized users cannot access job history
Authorized Scheduler users have full access to job history
Access control is properly enforced at UI and API levels
Access attempts are logged for audit purposes
No sensitive data is exposed through error messages
